image.altText: Queensland Fire Department

props.synopsis: The LNP has referred serious allegations of rape, sexual harassment and domestic violence within the Queensland Fire Department to the state's corruption watchdog.

title.children: Allegations of rape and sexual harassment within Queensland Fire Department referred to corruption watchdog

image.altText: A woman with glasses and a striped shirt looking at the camera

props.synopsis: A new state government campaign targets violence against teachers amid increasing reports of threats, bullying and violence against teachers and other school staff.

title.children: New campaign targets abuse against teachers, with some Queensland educators 'scared' by parental aggression

image.altText: A child sits in her mother's lap on the floor and they both smile.

props.synopsis: A service for children with autism say they have been overwhelmed by reports from parents saying their NDIS payments have been being slashed by up to 60 per cent when their plans are reviewed.

title.children: A specialised program helped Chloe's autistic daughter say 'I love you' for the first time, but she's been denied NDIS funding to go full-time

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair looks into the camera with a pained expression.

props.synopsis: Alison Whitfield's husband Dave, a veteran medic with the Australian Defence Force, took his own life earlier this year. She desperately hopes other families do not have to experience the same pain.

title.children: Alison and her husband issued a desperate plea for help on TV. Less than a year later, he was gone

image.altText: The Princess of Wales smiles while looking at something in her hand in a leafy-green garden

props.synopsis: The Princess of Wales confirms she is no longer receiving chemotherapy, and says she will return to a light program of external engagements in the coming months.

title.children: Princess of Wales no longer receiving chemotherapy and 'doing what I can to stay cancer free'

image.altText: A baby in hospital with burns.

props.synopsis: The nine-month-old was seriously burned in the attack at Stones Corner on August 27 and had to have surgery.

title.children: Baby boy's family 'devastated' man accused of coffee attack fled country a day before police confirmed his identity

image.altText: Composite image of a man wearing a suit and tie, and an image of race horses and money

props.synopsis: Paul Montgomery was brought in by these brothers as a trusted friend to run the financial side of their business but as they made him general manager, he stole millions, was duchessed by gambling company VIPs and lost it all while on a multi-million dollar losing streak.

title.children: VIP managers, shocking fraud, stolen millions. Inside the harrowing crimes of 'The Golden Goose'

image.altText: Wong Yew Chow

props.synopsis: A Singaporean high roller has been ordered to pay Star Entertainment Queensland more than $38 million.

title.children: Singaporean high roller ordered to pay Star Entertainment Queensland $38m for gambling debt

image.altText: Kelly Wilkinson stands alongside another woman, both are smiling.

props.synopsis: The court hears Bradley Bell is "not the man who actually caused the death" but was being tried for allegedly helping Brian Johnston kill his wife.

title.children: Colleague of man who murdered his ex-partner knew killer wanted to 'burn her' before driving him to her house, jury hears

image.altText: Shoppers walk through Pitt Street Mall

props.synopsis: With growth at the slowest pace in Australia since the recession of the early 1990s, we are now faced with an ongoing economic crisis in China — our biggest trading partner — and the prospect of a global economic slowdown.

title.children: Why the RBA will be forced to cut before year's end

image.altText: A boy with a blurry face holds a phone, the light illuminating his face against the darkened background.

props.synopsis: Age restrictions have been in the spotlight since national cabinet's rapid review of strategies to prevent domestic violence found children's access to free pornography online had "normalised" degrading and aggressive behaviours.

title.children: National social media age limit could soon be put in place under government plan

image.altText: A drone shot of a suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: New Australian Housing and Urban Institute research has found that about 70 per cent of households have reported building quality problems. It also found that most of Australia's existing housing stock was energy-inefficient and of poor quality.

title.children: More than two-thirds of Australian homes have building issues, new report says

image.altText: Q+A Housing Special panel

props.synopsis: The federal government is using the RBA as a “scapegoat” for mishandling the economy, the opposition says, as politicians are challenged on housing solutions.

title.children: Minister notes housing 'despair', opposition renews Chalmers attack

image.altText: Scott Morrison Iraq

props.synopsis: The ADF has long insisted there wasn't a greater risk of suicide for those in its ranks. With the release of findings from the royal commission into veterans' suicide, it's an argument that no longer stacks up.

title.children: The shame of veterans' suicide has long existed in the shadows. The royal commission's findings reveal the shocking truth

image.altText: A very large cockroach on a person's hand.

props.synopsis: There is a push to protect Queensland's Reedy Creek Reserve by having it recognised under a special state conservation law.

title.children: This giant burrowing cockroach could be the key to protecting 'undisturbed' coastal reserve

image.altText: A close-up of an Australian Army patch and an Australian flag patch on an ADF officer's uniform.

props.synopsis: The commissioners have called for a new permanent body to provide ongoing support to veterans.

title.children: Royal commission into veteran suicide hands down final report, calling for new support body

image.altText: A close up image of a woman with short brown hair against a black background.

props.synopsis: Minerals Council chief executive Tania Constable has warned the industry is in a precarious state, blaming "reckless" federal government industrial relations reforms, state "royalty raids", "onerous" looming environmental rules, and high energy costs.

title.children: 'Conflict has been brought upon us': Mining industry slams Albanese over industrial relations reform

image.altText: A man kneeling to the side of a motorcycle in front of a luxury car with a crushed front

props.synopsis: Four years after charges were dropped against the heir to the Red Bull empire over an alleged hit-and-run, eight people are under scrutiny, accused of helping him avoid court.

title.children: Billionaire's alleged hit-and-run testing theory only poor people go to jail in Thailand

image.altText: An older, bearded man with grey hair stands amid a crowd of journalist.

props.synopsis: Graeme McBride says he wants to be able to sleep on a dry pillow and lay in a comfortable position without a broken neck and heart.

title.children: Injured dad who lost wife, daughter in Hunter Valley bus crash tells court of ongoing trauma

image.altText: Aaron James is prepared by a doctor ahead of his partial face transplant.

props.synopsis: Scientists have found signs of retina function in an eye transplanted into a man a year ago — the first such operation involving a whole eye. The scientist who led the surgical team says the next step is understanding how to restore sight.

title.children: Scientists laud promising results from world's first whole eye transplant

image.altText: A man stands on the edge of a street in the foreground. Across the street are a number of large apartment buildings.

props.synopsis: Companies hired to manage millions of apartments across the country are exploiting owners in an industry with little regulation. Four Corners heard from more than 2,000 unit owners with horror stories of the industry's practices.

title.children: Secret deals and phantom fees: The 'unethical' tactics of Australian strata companies

image.altText: A woman in a green dress smiles in front of some microphones during an event for a sports tournament

props.synopsis: The National Gender Equity in Sports Governance Policy aims to achieve 50-50 gender equity on all national and state sport boards by 2027, with consequences for non-compliance.

title.children: Government announces gender reforms for Australian sport

image.altText: Lachlan Murdoch

props.synopsis: In a polarised media world, it's never been more important to understand Lachlan Murdoch.

title.children: 'Do I need to sell my house?' The perils of writing about media mogul Lachlan Murdoch

image.altText: Myer

props.synopsis: A major fashion retail consolidation is looming in Australia, as department store Myer considers buying up more than 700 of Premier Investment's apparel stores, including Just Jeans, Jay Jays, Portmans, Jacqui E and Dotti.

title.children: Australian fashion retail consolidation looming as Myer looks to buy Premier Investment's apparel brands

image.altText: Woman looking up in a bathroom.

props.synopsis: Civil and administration tribunals are unable to adjudicate disputes involving landlords that live in different states to their rental properties, leaving tenants and landlords facing costly legal action to seek redress for issues with their rentals.

title.children: The legal loophole creating a headache for renters and landlords wanting action

image.altText: A close up of Nicki Hutley sitting in an office.

props.synopsis: It's not just older generations who think younger people are doing it tough. The list of people concerned about the impact of inflation on households includes economists, the boss of the Commonwealth Bank, Matt Comyn, and the Reserve Bank.

title.children: 'You can't blame the boomers': The generational divide behind Australia's cost-of-living split

image.altText: Nicola Spurrier at press conference

props.synopsis: South Australia has reported a six year high in whooping cough cases as the illness spikes across the country.

title.children: Whooping cough cases surging, with vulnerable groups urged to get vaccinated

image.altText: People wading through chest high floodwaters

props.synopsis: The death toll from Typhoon Yagi reaches at least 59 in Vietnam, with major industrial hubs in the country's north hit by torrential rains and flooding.

title.children: Northern Vietnam inundated in aftermath of Typhoon Yagi as dozens more killed

image.altText: Three firefighters stand on the footpath near a red fire truck, looking towards a brick house with police tape across it.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating whether three children under five were home alone when they were critically injured in a fire at Sydenham in Melbourne's north-west.

title.children: Three children critically injured in Melbourne fire had moved into home a week ago, police say

image.altText: A man looks at the camera with a blank expression.

props.synopsis: An alleged four-wheel-drive attack has been linked to an online video which police say depicts "an abhorrent act of animal cruelty".

title.children: WA farming couple sickened after calves allegedly mowed down in four-wheel-drive video

image.altText: Josh Addo-Carr holds his hands on his hips

props.synopsis: Canterbury winger Josh Addo-Carr has allegedly returned a positive drug test on the eve of his side's return to the NRL finals.

title.children: Josh Addo-Carr allegedly returns positive cocaine test, Bulldogs say there is 'no truth' to claim

image.altText: Isaah Yeo is tackled by Sharks players

props.synopsis: Penrith and Melbourne are the firm favourites to play in this year's NRL grand final, but history shows the top two teams rarely face off in the decider.

title.children: 'It just doesn't work like that': Storm and Panthers on notice ahead of NRL finals

image.altText: A child with head tilted back receives oral drops with other children watching on

props.synopsis: UN officials say more than half of the 640,000 Gaza children who need to be immunised against polio have received the oral vaccine in the first two stages of the campaign.

title.children: Polio vaccination drive extended in southern Gaza Strip as parents rush to immunise children
